page.title: 01The Wing & Lother Skerry
page.content: Almost entirely sea, this block contains 2 small pieces of land, the tidle llother skerry,with an automatic navigation light mounted on an iron tower, and the wing,the extreme western tip of the coast around Burwick Bay. The wing is part of the site of a projected Ro-Ro ferry terminal,intended to provide a year round short-sea crossing between Orkney and Gills Bay, Caithness.The waers in this block are extremely turbulent and are characterised by special tidal conditions,strong currents, whirlpools and the second fastest tidal race in European waters. The beach at the wing is entirely rocky, and the cliffs are low. in rough weather the Lother Skerry is seen as a mass of boiling foam and huge waves. Frequently seals can be
